intro: Meehania henryi var. stachydifolia, commonly known as the hairy meehania, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
